qas.question: Do i need to fly with a face mask when visiting peru?

answers.text: Passengers need to wear two face masks on flights bound for Peru

qas.question: Do children need to be fully vaccinated before entering peru?

answers.text: All passengers to Peru of 12 years old or more whose final destination is Peru must show evidence of full vaccination received either in Peru or abroad or a negative COVID-19 PCR

paragraphs.context: Passengers need to wear two face masks on flights bound for Peru and must complete an affidavit before travel. All passengers to Peru of 12 years old or more whose final destination is Peru must show evidence of full vaccination received either in Peru or abroad or a negative COVID-19 PCR (molecular) test, issued a maximum of 48 hours before the flight departs. Those under 12 years old must be without COVID-19 symptoms but do not require a test or proof of vaccination. These rules are subject to change at short notice. You should arrange to take a private test. Land borders for international passenger transit remain closed for foreign nationals and non-residents in Peru. If you want to enter or leave Peru by land from any of these countries, you must request a special permit from the Peruvian Ministry of Foreign Affairs, and in some cases to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of your country of origin/destination. This may change at short notice, so you should check what restrictions are in place before you plan a trip to Peru by land.
